{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis with hypercalciuria. Blood studies demonstrate increased parathyroid hormone (PTH) and hypercalcemia. The patient's history is notable for several months of fatigue, constipation, left flank pain radiating to the abdomen and groin, and pink tinge to her urine. Considering these symptoms and laboratory results, it is likely that the abnormality in calcemia is related to parathyroid function. Measurement of intact parathormone in serum can help distinguishing between a parathyroid or nonparathyroid source of origin.", "answer_choice": "A"}
